results.title: Landholder Group Participation: a Model for Action
results.creator_credit: Peter Mountjoy and Warrenbayne Boho Land Protection Group
results.brief_description: Shows the process of landholders realising that the problems of salinity and erosion need to be tackled in groups rather than as individuals. Illustrates the establishment of the Warrenbayne Boho Land Protection Group. Shows the group working with Agriculture Extension Officers and Soil Conservation personnel, owning their involvement and taking responsibility for their actions. Useful as a model for people planning to establish community action groups.

results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit

video_links.name: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action

results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.

results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.
results.description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: James Kesteven, Mandy King, Miriana Marusic and Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.

results.title: Kanga Cricket
results.brief_description: An Australian Cricket Board primary development programme for kids, sponsored by the Australian Diary Corporation and supported by the Commonwealth Department of Sport, Recreation and Tourism. Demonstrates the concept of Kanga cricket, a simplified adaptation of traditional cricket rules introduced into Australian schools. Former Australian cricket captain Kim Hughes and Peter Russell-Clarke participate.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 25]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is a series of scenarios based on a question which is also the title of the reel: ‘Where is it?’ and features Kenneth’s son-in-law Bob Wootton as the person looking for the answer and responding to each segment. Kenneth has Bob look in a book from a bookshelf which contains the hand written sequence titles. Kenneth also uses both black and white and colour sequences to add to the more dramatic feel of the reel. Kenneth has Bob pondering the title questions through the sequences as well as laughing at the end of some. the reel ends with Bob laughing uproariously.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:57:00 first colour scenario begins with title ‘Mr McCraw’s Orchids’ showing us Mr McCraw among his orchid plants in a hothouse as well as Kenneth’s favoured individual shots of individual blooms.

00:02:29:00 we see the next sub title, ‘Eastern Beach Geelong’ followed by colour footage of children playing in the water, foreshore recreational equipment such as diving boards and waterwheels, piers and crowds on the boardwalks and swimmers in and out of the water.

00:05:18:00 several yachts appear in the sea in what could be a race.

00:05:44:00 Bob opens the book again to the sub title ‘Skating at St Moritz’ followed by a colour sequence of a large scale ice skating show involving multiple performers and skotches at St Moritz, (presumably) in Melbourne’s St Kilda.

00:07:45:00 starts with the sub titles, ‘Hobbies - What is yours? Is it Model Boats?’ with Bob gazing toward footage of some intricate model boats and ships sailing and steaming around a shallow (and what appears to be purpose built) pool. The pool is surrounded by older children who appear to be operating the models.

00:14:52:00 Bob reveals the next question ‘or is it Model Trains?’. Here Kenneth shows us a group of men who operate model trains on a track raised high enough from the ground that they are able to ride the trains which seem to operate by steam.

00:18:21:00 ‘Or is it like mine - The Camera?’. Here we see a man in a park with what looks like a ‘box brownie’ camera taking pictures of seemingly random women (though we have seen one of them in other reels).

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 13]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film, ‘The Sequel’, shows various snapshots of his travels almost as if these scenes are the offcuts of other reels. It is more difficult to locate his footage as Kenneth has not included his usual signs and location titles.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:06:00 title ‘The Sequel’ followed by scenes of waterways, a building with razorwire brick fence, houses, sloping green landscapes and various sea vessels back on the water - ferries, larger and smaller boats and sailing boats all in quick succession.

00:02:08:00 a train carrying coal, then more waterways including a road causeway across the water, a large church and a large hill and more water scenes.

00:02:38:00 prosperous looking farmland, market gardens and houses on a hillside, trees and hills and the sea.

00:03:20:00 old, crumbling buildings on a large scale; a newer house and a woman chopping wood followed by scenes of houses. a town street and farmland near a river and hills.

00:04:30:00 ‘Blue Horizon’ title begins a sequence of houses and a town along a river and the sea, Bettye Rankine and Bob Wootton walking on the sand.

00:05:35:00 the first of a few upside-down frames appear - a church and a town. These are followed by scenes of a large and possibly industrial country town near the sea.

00:07:17:00 shot of a steam train and an engine reversing into a crowded station.

Patsy Comes To Stay

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 11]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is a scenic tour of mostly seaside places, from Sydney Harbour and Port Phillip Bay to a brief look at Phillip Island. The Rankine family members feature and are joined by Bob Wootton late in the reel who contributes to their roadside picnic by cooking meat on a barbecue over a fire in a tin. Kenneth uses individual title cards to clearly point out the locations he is filming and fnishes sunset scenes. Kenneth also uses title cards to introduce each sequence.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:12:00 ‘Sydney and the Harbour’, views across the Harbour to residential areas; Kenneth appears to be filming from a vantage point on the water.

00:01:07:00 Harbour Bridge followed by shots of ferries and dockside buildings; a larger ship comes into view as well as Fort Denison Island and a longer shot of the Harbour Bridge.

00:03:20:00 ‘Manly’, the pier and some buildings.

00:03:40:00 shops and shoppers with the camera taking in the view down to the Harbour; beach scenes and a large ship in the distance.

00:04:48:00 ‘Blue Mountains from Echo Point’ is followed by dramatic views over the mountain ranges and rock formations.

00:05::39:00 the Rankines meeting some other travellers along a walking track.

00:05:51:00 scenes of a sports club and members relaxing, the men are in blazers.

00:06:16:00 ‘The Cascades Leura’, waterfalls, a footbridge and Mrs and Miss Rankine splashing at the foot of a waterfall.

00:07:41:00 a band playing in a large rotunda Spanish exhibition dancing for onlookers; this sequence also shows good examples of vintage bathers.

00:08:32:00 ‘St Kilda’, the St Kilda Botanical Gardens.

00:09:17:00 scenes looking across Pier Rd to the St Kilda Pier, kiosk and a yacht followed by shots of swimmers.

00:10:07:00 ‘At Elwood’ shows more examples of vintage bathing costumes with a beach coat and caps and launching a sail boat straight from the sand.

00:11:14:00 ‘At Mid Brighton’ small craft bobbing in shallow waters followed by a yacht race and Kenneth’s daughter with binoculars looking on.

00:13:07:00 ‘At Sandringham’ shows another sequence of swimmers, people sunbathing, sailboats and diving from what might be an old piece of a jetty, sitting on rocks on the shoreline; there are bathing boxes in the background on the beach.

00:16:50:00 a small boat being hoisted down from a shed and rolled on tracks into the water.

00:18:00:00 onwards we see the Rankines joined by Bob Wootton who contributes to their roadside picnic with his meat patties/ burgers, barbecued over a fire in a tin.

00:18:32:00 ‘Phillip Island’ is introduced with a postcard before coastal views and several shots of koalas in trees, the family wandering along a road.
results.title_for_label: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 11]
results.description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is a scenic tour of mostly seaside places, from Sydney Harbour and Port Phillip Bay to a brief look at Phillip Island. The Rankine family members feature and are joined by Bob Wootton late in the reel who contributes to their roadside picnic by cooking meat on a barbecue over a fire in a tin. Kenneth uses individual title cards to clearly point out the locations he is filming and fnishes sunset scenes. Kenneth also uses title cards to introduce each sequence.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows footage of Mt Buffalo and the Grampians, in Victoria, filmed in September 1944. Footage shows spectacular views from high up, waterfalls and rock formations and a peep at some buildings. Kenneth’s camera lingers over many of the waterfalls before moving onto a selection of flowers and bushes before ending the reel with pink tinged clouds. Title cards are used throughout the film.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:12:00 ‘Mt Buffalo September 1944’ low lying clouds and overlooking misty, foggy mountain scenery.
00:02:32:00 group of young women wearing jodhpurs which were worn by women at time for ourdoor activity.
00:03:50:00 hikers walking up a trial.

00:03:55:00 ‘Pulpit Rock’ sign followed by ‘Lake Catani’, a walking track, spillway, views across the lake and a group sitting on a short pier.

00:06:09:00 walkers waving at the camera from a high, jutting rock formation and viewing platform (possibly ‘the Monolith’).

00:10:08:00 filmmaker Kenneth walking along a track.

00:10:31:00 ‘View Point’ and hikers looking out over a dramatic view.

00:12:19:00 a group of hikers coming downwards and waving at the camera; sequence ends with pink tinged clouds.

00:12:42:00 ‘The Grampians September 1944’ appears followed by a distinctive tractor ploughing or planting in a farm paddock before moving to the scenery of the Grampians.

00:13:18:00 ‘Broken Falls’ sign, top of the waterfall and then full cascading waters across a wide section of rocks.
